sentence: AP Photo/Mead Gruver, File Republican Harriet Hageman, during a recent New York Times interview, couldn't say who won the 2020 presidential election.
author: John L. Dorman
title: Rep. Liz Cheney's leading GOP primary challenger says she doesn't know who lawfully won the 2020 presidential election

sentence: The paper noted that if the bill had become law, voters may not have known for certain who was running before having to register with a certain party.? Supporters of the bill, including Trump and attorney Harriet Hageman, whom Trump has endorsed against Cheney in the primary, said it would have prevented Democrats and independents from changing their party registration on Election Day in order to vote in a Republican primary.
author: Kate Scanlon
title: Trump-backed Wyoming elections bill fails to pass, in boon to Liz Cheney
